title: On canonical number systems and monogenity of pure number fields
authors: Hamid Ben Yakkou and Brahim Boudine
abstract:
Let $m$ be a rational integer $(m \neq 0, \pm 1)$ and consider a pure number
field $K = \mathbb{Q} (\sqrt[n]{m}) $ with $n \ge 3$. Most papers discussing
the monogenity of pure number fields focus only on the case where $m$ is
square-free. In this paper, based on a classical theorem of Ore on the prime
ideal decomposition \cite{MN92, O}, we study the monogenity of $K$ with $m$ is
not necessarily square-free. As an application, several examples of the
application of monogenic fields to CNS (Canonical Number System) are shown. In
this way, our results extend some parts of previously established results
\cite{BFC, BF, HNHCNS}.
